WRITING.TEXT: We need a sub so badly but we all know Wenger won't bring anyone on until around the 80th minute
Coq is scaring me, I feel like he might get himself sent off
Doesn't seem like we know what we're doing going forward. I think if we get a goal it will be on a counter.
Alexis at striker again? Come on...
This. Although I think for a title challenge it has to be someone on Mustafi's level or higher. Jonny Evans isn't going to cut it imo.
Year after year I end up drafting a shitty TE, but last year I managed to get Eifert. This year I'm looking at Walker or Kelce.
I don't want us to rush him, we have plenty of depth at WR.
Are you saying that Iwobi is the only one that's Arsenal through and through in that entire starting XI?

I applaud your optimism and hope you're right, however we are in danger of falling behind the other top clubs. We need to spend some now in order to be able to keep Ozil and Alexis, as well as keep our spot in the top 4.
Don't understand why he's keeping Gnabry unless he's planning on letting Joel go. A loan move to a club like Hertha Berlin would be excellent for him, rotting on the bench would not.

"The player could be worth 5 or 10, but an English club comes in, it could be 35, 40, or 50."
The player is worth whatever the club is selling them for, come on now. it's as if Wenger goes on transfermarkt every day and looks up their price.
Yeah, I bet we sign him on deadline day.
Surprised we can even consider him a target at this point, we all know Wenger would rather stick with Walcott as a backup striker.
Liverpool have Klavan, Lovren, Matip, and Sakho. Surely this is bullshit, probably just Valencia wanting us to pay more. I really hope it works.
They send bids back and forth by carrier pigeon.
I mean, he did just fine last year without a good QB, but defenses will definitely expect him to get the ball on most downs. I still think he will produce though.
I think he'd fit in perfectly when he isn't injured, but he's most likely going to spend more time injured than fit.
Definitely agree, Batshuayi would have been great.
We can afford almost any striker, but I'm not sure who would actually want to come. Lacazette is probably most likely at this point, but I'm prepared to be disappointed.
And at a club with the financial resources that we have, ambition means trophies.
Why is it so hard to just give them what they ask for? Not every price needs to be negotiated, and it's not like paying 30 mil instead of 25 mil is going to bankrupt our club.
Ok so let's hurry the fuck up and sign him before Abdennour leaves. Jesus, why do all of our transfers take ages? We've been "targeting" him for like 3 weeks now. Just give them the money already.
Hopefully he doesn't lose his confidence, I'm sure his future is bright.

Well, if there was any doubt before about our need for another centre back that's definitely gone. 'm sure we can without a shadow of a doubt expect at least a CB signing by the end of the window, so that's a positive. Hopefully Wenger's head is finally out of his ass.
Came on when we were three goals down in his debut, anyone would lack sharpness in that situation.
I know, I'm skeptical as well, but that was me trying to be optimistic.

Sadly, I do agree with what he's saying. Arsene isn't the right man for the job under our current situation. We need to buy someone and the board won't spend, so Wenger has to make them willing to spend. He can't just roll over and take what he's given. What I don't like is how negative he is. We're only 1 game in, there's plenty of time to turn it around.
"We paid for the lack of experience in the back" and who's fault is that Mr. Wenger?
Give up on it, we won't sign him. As much as I want him it's not happening.
He would have torn Moreno a new asshole. I cannot understand why Wenger didn't change it up. Ridiculous.

Feel bad for Holding and Chambers, they weren't ready for this. Wenger should have bought someone knowing Mertesacker would be out for a long period of time before our USA tour began. Horrible management on his part.

1. First of all, typical Arsenal match, I'm not surprised. 2. Holding and Chambers aren't ready yet, Wenger should have prepared much better. 3. Monreal was horrible today. 4. Xhaka and Coq cannot be paired together again, both give away waaaay too many fouls. 5. Of course with the fucking injuries again, this sucks. 6. Walcott was shit but not as shit as last year. 7. Alexis can't play striker. 8. We need to sign a defender really badly.
Really good goal, but we need more
And here come the injuries...
Seems like every time we play Liverpool we dominate and they score an undeserved goal. 95th minute Skrtel equalizer, Joe Allen's equalizer last year, it sucks.
Would have really liked to go into halftime leading...
That Lovren challenge on Alexis was so dirty, didn't even go for the ball at all.
Tidy finish
PEN!! I CAN'T BELIEVE IT!!
I'm impressed so far.
Walcott taking corners......

I'm talking about attacking mids, De Bruyne and Di Maria mostly play on the wing, and Rakitic, Iniesta, and Pjanic all play deeper roles. Silva is the only one that commonly plays attacking mid and Ozil outshines him every time Arsenal plays City.
That's what happens when 3 first team center backs are injured/not match fit.

Hmm. A little disappointed to see Xhaka left out of the starting XI but I can understand why. On the formation posted on Twitter they had Walcott on the right and Alexis up top but I'm thinking that will be switched in game.
And who's better?
You realize they're playing Bournemouth correct?
I remember saying this every year since then as well.
He said that everyone in his attack has to have had more than 10 goals last season, yet puts Origi as his striker!
The fact that he says he doesn't rate Koscielny and that when both are fit, Sakho gets in the National Team ahead of Koscielny...When he said that I just couldn't help but to burst out laughing.
A little comedic relief for everyone ahead of tomorrow's match haha.

The atmosphere at the Etihad is terrible yet again, was kind of expecting the fans to be excited because of Pep and the new signings.
Why would you?

Edit: Well, I guess we were all wrong
This happened last year as well and he ended up being out for months.

Can't see Wenger not playing Santi in the number 10, and Walcott is going to start without a doubt.
Edit: Santi doesn't start even though he was getting tons of minutes this preseason. Ok
God I hate Lamela
Can't believe they'd even post something like this before the season has even gotten going.
Wilshere should be sold. He rarely plays and we have several midfielders that are better than him, and we can still get a decent amount of money for him.
Who's playing striker?
This is excellent business for Palace. While Bolasie is an exciting player I feel that he was a burden for Palace.
Well he's just wrong.
QB: Cousins. He'll prove that he can win against good defenses. RB: Langford. He'll be better than Forte. WR: Watkins, as long as him and Taylor both stay healthy.
Not disagreeing, but a lot of players do seem to want to play in the premier league, and playing striker behind the likes of Ozil, Alexis, Cazorla, and Xhaka isn't exactly terrible.
Ozil has already said he would sign, he just needs to do it. Not sure about Alexis but I'm not at all worried.
Does he ever just shut up? Seems like every time he talks something stupid comes out of his mouth.
No one picked us, I like it. We don't have the pressure we had last year, I think that will help with our mentality.

Cech Bellerin Chambers Monreal Gibbs Ramsey Xhaka Ox Cazorla Alexis Walcott
Not what I'd prefer us to go with, but we could do a job with this.

Not even going to try to predict what the score line will be. I have no clue what to expect from Liverpool, will they be the team that won 4-0, lost 4-0, or somewhere in between? However I think even though we don't have Ozil, Kos, or Giroud, we can still get a result. Anxious to see which winger will step up this season, this first match should give us a hint.

Due to his versatility I think he'll end up playing whatever position someone who is injured normally plays. If Ozil (god forbid) picks up an injury then he'll slot in at the number 10, if Ramsey or Xhaka get injured, he could play the deeper role alongside Elneny or Coq. Hell, we could even see him on the wing if we get that many injuries (and we all know, chances are it will get bad).
This sounds like one of those Boring James Milner tweets

I thought I was the only one who thought this...yes he does provide a breath of fresh air, but honestly he has no place in the starting XI. We could get a decent amount for him from a team challenging for a spot in Europe. He lives and breathes Arsenal and it would be very sad to see him go, but it might just have to be done.
He's not good enough to start, yet he isn't bad enough to only play in the cup matches. I say he stays on the bench until he gets injured.
I enjoyed the 15 part, not the 16 part.

Exactly, if you look at this you'd think "oh wow, those are really good numbers" but our midfield can create enough chances for Giroud to score a goal at least every 90 minutes or so. If he can put them away, then we can win.
I don't know what to think anymore. I think I'd like to just go into a coma until the window closes.
Well surely this means he's coming, I mean I'm not sure how much more proof you'd need, liking a picture on Instagram is basically the same as signing the contract

Agreed, considering he is also a versatile player that can play on the wing as well as a number 9. He complements Giroud very well, I wouldn't be opposed to putting him on the wing if we need to. Not to mention his eye for goal is excellent.
Most of these dribbles result in either an over-hit cross or a wild shot.
What exactly is Griezmann's release clause? Does anyone know? Surely around 70 mil
NBC's coverage is horrible. They cut to commercial for no reason in the middle of an event.
I'm just outside of Harrisburg, I only know of one other gooner in my entire school. We're endangered here.
Tell me how we can give him higher wages than Bayern
Being frustrated with our transfer policy is justifiable, but I do agree that repeatedly making these posts are not necessary.
It can't be called a downfall yet, although if we fail to sign anyone else this window and finish below 4th then I think downfall is justified

WRITING.TITLE: ESPN vs Yahoo
WRITING.TEXT: Which platform is better? Used ESPN last year but a few guys want to use Yahoo this year, is one better than the other?

Money talks I guess
Don't think Mustafi would be 3rd choice...
If Gabriel is out for an extended period of time then Wenger will have to buy someone new. Until then I say Holding and Chambers with Monreal filling in if necessary

Well, on a positive note it looks like Wenger will have to sign a new CB as Gabriel's injury doesn't look great. He's really stupid sometimes but I do enjoy his moments of brilliance, hopefully he won't be out for too long.
Mustafi
What we need is confidence and match fitness. We are getting both from playing these teams.
